title: How to Make Fried Grasshopper

steps.headline: Let them sit overnight to "empty" themselves.
steps.description: Alternatively, shake the jar to scare them.

steps.headline: Boil them for five or ten minutes in water.
Remove wings and legs if they are very large.
Drop in a paper or plastic bag with seasoned white or yellow Cornmeal.
Pull them out when golden brown.

text: Catch some grasshoppers.  Let them sit overnight to "empty" themselves. Alternatively, shake the jar to scare them. Boil them for five or ten minutes in water.  Remove from water, pat dry.  Remove wings and legs if they are very large.  Dip in beaten eggs.  Drop in a paper or plastic bag with seasoned white or yellow Cornmeal.  Heat oil to about 350 °F (177 °C).  Throw in your grasshoppers.  Pull them out when golden brown.  Drain on paper towels.
